bibl.title: An Inscribed Hadra Hydria in the Pelizaeus Museum, Hildesheim.
bibl.note: Inv. 1190. Hydria of Egyptian clay. Workshop of the Branchless Laurel. Ink inscription naming an offical Philon, here styled agorastes, who is known from texts dated to 243-233 BC.
bibl.seg: Connor P.J., An Inscribed Hadra Hydria in the Pelizaeus Museum, Hildesheim.
Inv. 1190. Hydria of Egyptian clay. Workshop of the Branchless Laurel. Ink inscription naming an offical Philon, here styled agorastes, who is known from texts dated to 243-233 BC.
